ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: where does the subject receive regular healthcare
when was last visit to doctor
when was date of last physical
does subject have any illnesses
describe the illness
has the subject had any hospitalisations
describe the hospitalisations
when was the subject hospitalized
subject's current medications
Describe subject's current medications
what are subjects past medications
describe subjects past medications
Immunizations
does the subject have any sensitivites or allergies to any drugs
describe subjects sensitivities or allergies to any drugs
did the mother experience any illnesses during pregnancy
was the mother given any medication during pregnancy
were fertility drugs used to help conceive subject
In this pregnancy, did the birth mother do any of the following activities - Drink alcohol
In this pregnancy, did the birth mother do any of the following activities - Use recreational drugs (e.g. marijuana, cocaine, etc)
was the mother given any medication for that illness during pregnancy
In this pregnancy, did the birth mother do any of the following activities - Smoke cigarettes or other tobacco products
How much did this baby weigh at birth (pounds)
How was the baby delivered
were forceps or a vacuum used to aid delivery
was the pregnancy carried to fullterm
How much did this baby weigh at birth (ounces)
What were the babys APGAR scores - first APGAR (at 1 minute)
was the light exposure natural or artificial
How many days total did this baby stay in the hospital (after delivery up until discharge, including the neonatal ICU) (days)
Any additional notes
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: was the subject exposed to light therapy during pregnancy or following birth
What were the babys APGAR scores - second APGAR (at 5 minutes)
